allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add technical documentation for EPS torque prediction project

Documentation covers:
- Project overview and goals
- Data pipeline \(features, target, preprocessing\)
- Model architectures \(LSTM, Attention variants, CNN\)
- Training configuration and Optuna hyperparameter tuning
- Evaluation metrics and interpretation
- Setup and configuration guide

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(gh pr create --title "feat: Multi-seed evaluation with bootstrap CI and Cohen''s d" --body "$\(cat <<''EOF''
## Summary

- Add attention weight saving during training and evaluation
- Restructure project: unified configs, batch runner, shared evaluation library
- Add multi-seed support to bootstrap evaluation \(law of total variance\)
- Add automatic pairwise model comparisons with permutation tests and Cohen''s d effect sizes
- Add comprehensive evaluation report with statistical interpretation

## Key Changes

- **Attention saving**: Save attention weights per epoch and at test time via config flag
- **Shared library** \(`scripts/shared/`\): Centralized model configs, checkpoint discovery, metrics, paths
- **Batch runner** \(`scripts/batch_runner.py`\): Unified train/evaluate pipeline replacing .bat/.sh scripts
- **Bootstrap evaluation**: Multi-seed aggregation, 9 predefined comparison pairs, Cohen''s d effect sizes
- **Evaluation report**: Full results for 8 models x 3 seeds with statistical analysis

## Test plan

- [x] Bootstrap evaluation runs without errors across all 8 models and 3 seeds
- [x] JSON serialization works for all numpy types
- [x] Comparison tables generated in markdown and LaTeX
- [x] Evaluation report reviewed for correctness

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -C "C:\\Users\\MSchm\\Documents\\att_project" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
feat\(eval\): Add 5-seed sequence-level evaluation results and report

Retrained all 8 models with sequence-level split \(5 seeds: 7, 42, 94,
123, 231\) and ran sequence-level statistical evaluation. Key finding:
Attention mechanisms show no practical benefit on sequence-level - the
previous advantage of Simple Attention was an artifact of data leakage.

Includes:
- Updated eval results for seeds 42/94/123 \(retrained with seq split\)
- New eval results for seeds 7/231
- Sequence-level bootstrap CIs, permutation tests, effect sizes
- Comprehensive report comparing old vs new methodology
- Updated attention weights for all seeds

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

\)")
